wrack.gloss: the destruction or collapse of something
growth of marine vegetation especially of the large forms such as rockweeds and kelp

wraith.gloss: a mental representation of some haunting experience

wrangle.gloss: an instance of intense argument (as in bargaining)
to quarrel noisily, angrily or disruptively

wrangler.gloss: a cowboy who takes care of the saddle horses

wrangling.gloss: an instance of intense argument (as in bargaining)

wrap.gloss: cloak that is folded or wrapped around a person
the covering (usually paper or cellophane) in which something is wrapped
arrange or fold as a cover or protection
enclose or enfold completely with or as if with a covering

wrapper.gloss: a loose dressing gown for women
the covering (usually paper or cellophane) in which something is wrapped

wrapping.gloss: the covering (usually paper or cellophane) in which something is wrapped

wrath.gloss: belligerence aroused by a real or supposed wrong (personified as one of the deadly sins)

wreath.gloss: flower arrangement consisting of a circular band of foliage or flowers for ornamental purposes

wreck.gloss: an accident that destroys a ship at sea
a serious accident (usually involving one or more vehicles)

wrecker.gloss: someone who commits sabotage or deliberately causes wrecks
a truck equipped to hoist and pull wrecked cars (or to remove cars from no-parking zones)

wreckfish.gloss: brown fish of the Atlantic and Mediterranean found around rocks and shipwrecks

wrecking.gloss: the event of a structure being completely demolished and leveled
destruction achieved by causing something to be wrecked or ruined

wrecking bar.gloss: a heavy iron lever with one end forged into a wedge

wren.gloss: English architect who designed more than fifty London churches (1632-1723)
any of several small active brown birds of the northern hemisphere with short upright tails

wren-tit.gloss: small brown bird of California resembling a wren

wrench.gloss: a sharp strain on muscles or ligaments
a hand tool that is used to hold or twist a nut or bolt
twist or pull violently or suddenly, especially so as to remove (something) from that to which it is attached or from where it originates
twist and compress, as if in pain or anguish
twist suddenly so as to sprain

wrestle.gloss: the act of engaging in close hand-to-hand combat
to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling)

wrestler.gloss: combatant who tries to throw opponent to the ground

wrestling.gloss: the act of engaging in close hand-to-hand combat
the sport of hand-to-hand struggle between unarmed contestants who try to throw each other down

wretchedness.gloss: a state of ill-being due to affliction or misfortune

wrick.gloss: a painful muscle spasm especially in the neck or back (`rick' and `wrick' are British)
twist suddenly so as to sprain

wriggle.gloss: to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling)

wriggler.gloss: one who can't stay still (especially a child)

wright.gloss: United States writer of detective novels (1888-1939)
United States writer whose work is concerned with the oppression of African Americans (1908-1960)

United States aviation pioneer who (with his brother Wilbur Wright) invented the airplane (1871-1948)
United States early feminist (born in Scotland) (1795-1852)

wring.gloss: twist and press out of shape
twist and compress, as if in pain or anguish

wrinkle.gloss: a slight depression or fold in the smoothness of a surface
gather or contract into wrinkles or folds
make wrinkles or creases on a smooth surface
become wrinkled or crumpled or creased

wrist.gloss: a joint between the distal end of the radius and the proximal row of carpal bones

wrist band.gloss: a band or bracelet worn around the wrist

wrist bone.gloss: any of the eight small bones of the wrist of primates

wrist joint.gloss: a joint between the distal end of the radius and the proximal row of carpal bones

wrist pin.gloss: pin joining a piston to a connecting rod

wrist watch.gloss: a watch that is worn strapped to the wrist

wristband.gloss: a band of cloth or leather or metal links attached to a wristwatch and wrapped around the wrist

wristlet.gloss: a band or bracelet worn around the wrist

wristwatch.gloss: a watch that is worn strapped to the wrist

writ.gloss: (law) a legal document issued by a court or judicial officer

writ of certiorari.gloss: a common law writ issued by a superior court to one of inferior jurisdiction demanding the record of a particular case

writ of execution.gloss: a routine court order that attempts to enforce the judgment that has been granted to a plaintiff by authorizing a sheriff to carry it out

writ of habeas corpus.gloss: a writ ordering a prisoner to be brought before a judge

writ of mandamus.gloss: an extraordinary writ commanding an official to perform a ministerial act that the law recognizes as an absolute duty and not a matter for the official's discretion

write-down.gloss: (accounting) reduction in the book value of an asset

write-in.gloss: a candidate for public office whose name does not appear on the ballot and so must be written on the ballot by the voters

write-in candidate.gloss: a candidate for public office whose name does not appear on the ballot and so must be written on the ballot by the voters

write-off.gloss: (accounting) reduction in the book value of an asset

write up.gloss: a short account of the news

writer.gloss: writes (books or stories or articles or the like) professionally (for pay)

writer's cramp.gloss: muscular spasms of thumb and forefinger while writing with a pen or pencil

writer's name.gloss: the name that appears on the by-line to identify the author of a work

writing.gloss: the act of creating written works
the activity of putting something in written form

writing pad.gloss: a pad of paper on which messages can be written

writing style.gloss: a style of expressing yourself in writing

writing system.gloss: a method of representing the sounds of a language by written or printed symbols

writings.gloss: the third of three divisions of the Hebrew Scriptures

written account.gloss: a written document preserving knowledge of facts or events

written communication.gloss: communication by means of written symbols (either printed or handwritten)

written document.gloss: writing that provides information (especially information of an official nature)

written language.gloss: communication by means of written symbols (either printed or handwritten)

written record.gloss: a written document preserving knowledge of facts or events

written report.gloss: a written document describing the findings of some individual or group

written text.gloss: something written, especially copied from one medium to another, as a typewritten version of dictation

wroclaw.gloss: a city in southwestern Poland on the Oder

wrong.gloss: that which is contrary to the principles of justice or law
any harm or injury resulting from a violation of a legal right
not appropriate for a purpose or occasion

wrong 'un.gloss: a cricket ball bowled as if to break one way that actually breaks in the opposite way

wrongdoer.gloss: a person who transgresses moral or civil law

wrongdoing.gloss: departure from what is ethically acceptable

wrongful conduct.gloss: activity that transgresses moral or civil law

wrongfulness.gloss: that which is contrary to the principles of justice or law

wrongness.gloss: the quality of not conforming to fact or truth

wrymouth.gloss: eellike Atlantic bottom fish with large almost vertical mouth

wryneck.gloss: an unnatural condition in which the head leans to one side because the neck muscles on that side are contracted

clothe, as if for protection from the elements

wreak.gloss: cause to happen or to occur as a consequence

wring from.gloss: get or cause to become in a difficult or laborious manner

write.gloss: write or name the letters that comprise the conventionally accepted form of (a word or part of a word)

write down.gloss: reduce the estimated value of something

write off.gloss: reduce the estimated value of something

wrapped.gloss: covered with or as if with clothes or a wrap or cloak

wretched.gloss: of very poor quality or condition

wriggling.gloss: moving in a twisting or snake-like or wormlike fashion

wriggly.gloss: moving in a twisting or snake-like or wormlike fashion

wrinkleproof.gloss: of fabric that does not wrinkle easily

writhing.gloss: moving in a twisting or snake-like or wormlike fashion
